answerText: Milky Way[10] The bulge in the center of the Milky Way is bracketed by one of these structures. Spiral galaxies that contain these structures are on the bottom part of the fork of the Hubble tuning fork.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 6 | 14 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The existence of galaxies other than this one was the subject of the Shapley-Curtis debate, and its existence creates the Zone of Avoidance. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this spiral galaxy, which is also the subject of the Oort constants. The Orion Arm of this galaxy contains our Solar system.
